The bearing clearance monitoring system by Liebherr is a digital condition monitoring for slewing bearings, which is ideal for use in various applications, from mining and material handling up to maritime equipment. The BCM can be used to measure bearing wear in axial and radial directions, as well as tilting clearance. Such a digital system does not only ensure flexibility in measurement, but also reduced downtime, lower costs in maintenance and, above all, increased protection of personnel. 

The focus of digital clearance maintenance lies on personnel safety. Since the measuring devices are already permanently installed on the bearing, service technicians will not have to mount dial gauges or other measuring devices directly onto the slewing bearing in dangerous areas under the excavator or other machines. An additional advantage is the fact that measurements can be carried out at any time autonomously, without the help of external service providers.

Smart, integrated and remote, the bearing clearance monitoring is a small helper with great effects.


Further information: 
https://www.liebherr.com/en-de/components/innovations/digitisation/smart-bearing-condition-monitoring-4689614

Mercer Torgau, ehemals bekannt als HIT-Holz, ist Europas gr√∂√üter Hersteller von Europaletten und einer der bedeutendsten S√§gewerksstandorte Deutschlands. 

‚ÄãUm den hohen Anforderungen in der Holzverarbeitung
gerecht zu werden, setzt Mercer Torgau auf zuverl√§ssige, vielseitige und
effiziente Maschinen. Die Wahl fiel auf Liebherr-Timber Maschinen, die mit
ihrer Zuverl√§ssigkeit, dem Bedienkomfort und der einfachen Handhabung punkten. Eine Vorf√ºhrung des LH 35 Timber hinterlie√ü bei Mercer Torgau einen so starken Eindruck, dass der gesamte Fuhrpark der Holzfahrmaschinen innerhalb von zwei Jahren auf Liebherr umgestellt wurde. Heute besteht er aus vier LH 26 Timber, sechs LH 35 Timber und einem LH 50 Timber mit Rundholzanh√§nger, die im 24-Stunden-Betrieb den hohen Anforderungen des Unternehmens gerecht werden.

Discover Liebherr Mining's Autonomous Haulage Solution (AHS), co-developed with Fortescue. The AHS, part of Liebherr's IoMine integrated operations technology portfolio, is transforming mining operations by combining advanced automation with real-time data insights to enhance productivity, safety and efficiency. This innovative ecosystem includes an integrated Fleet Management System (FMS) and Machine Guidance System (MGS). The Fleet Management System (FMS) integrates mining operations to boost productivity, optimise haulage assignments and maximise fleet utilisation ‚Äì all of which helps to reduce non-productive time across the entire load-haul-dump value chain. The MGS delivers critical material information to minimise ore variability and dilution, improving overall performance.

‚ÄãLa nueva gr√∫a sobre orugas de v√≠a estrecha LR 1700-1.0W de Gr√∫as Aguado demostr√≥ todas sus capacidades en su primer trabajo, con el montaje de ocho aerogeneradores en el parque e√≥lico Cascante, en Navarra, con alturas de buje de 119 metros. Sin embargo, la nueva gr√∫a de 700 toneladas no est√° ni mucho menos al l√≠mite de su rendimiento, ya que est√° dise√±ada para el montaje de modernos aerogeneradores con alturas de buje de hasta 170 metros. ‚ÄãDer neue Schmalspur Raupenkran LR 1700-1.0W des spanischen Kunden Aguado kann seine Leistungsf√§higkeit bereits bei seinem ersten Einsatz unter Beweis stellen: Bei der Montage von acht Windkraftanlagen im Windpark Cascante in Navarra mit Nabenh√∂hen von 119 Metern. ‚ÄãThe new LR 1700-1.0W narrow-track crawler crane from Spanish customer Aguado is already proving its capabilities on its first job: during the assembly of eight wind turbines at the Cascante wind farm in Navarra with hub heights of 119 meters. However, the new 700-tonn-crane is nowhere near its performance limit, as it is designed for the assembly of modern wind turbines with hub heights of up to 170 meters. It offers significantly higher load capacities and hub heights than its predecessor, the LR 1600/2-W. The basis for this is a more powerful basic machine as well as the 3.5-meter-wide H-lattice type sections in the lower area of the main boom, which increase the lateral stability of the entire system. Liebherr also offers the LR 1700-1.0W with a luffing jib. This option was not available for its predecessor.

#liebherr #windturbine #windpower #windfarm

Liebherr-Australia has made history with the world‚Äôs first-ever repower of two R 9800 excavators for Yancoal at Mount Thorley Warkworth in the Hunter Valley, NSW.

In this timelapse video, watch as our team removes the existing engines and replaces them with Liebherr D9812 engines, purpose-built for the demanding conditions of mining operations. This milestone project showcases our commitment to innovation, efficiency, and customer collaboration‚Äîdelivering increased reliability, fuel savings, and performance to Yancoal‚Äôs fleet.

Thank you to our team at Liebherr Mount Thorley and Yancoal for making this project a success!

The Liebherr 33 L fast-erecting crane from Edificam has already completed its first job: the construction of a house of approx. 300 m2 in Calvia, Palma de Mallorca.

Cranes in the L series can be made ready for use quickly. Their compact design makes them ideal for sites with constricted space.

The 25 L and 33 L are the new L cranes. In addition to ease of assembly and flexibility, the L series also features Liebherr's latest in-house control generation. With the Tower Crane OS 2, you are at the cutting edge of technology. This control system already fulfils the requirements of tomorrow. It also brings innovation and safety to your construction site.

To the L-series: https://go.liebherr.com/1j6dg7

‚ÄãIntroducing the R 9300 G8, the most efficient 250-tonne excavator. With its innovative features enabled through continous improvement programs by the Liebherr team, this excavator redefines productivity standards in the mining industry.

At Bauma 2004 in Munich, Liebherr presented the LG 1750 lattice boom mobile crane, which combined the advantages of a mobile crane with the lifting capacity of a 750-tonne lattice boom crane. Painted in red and white, it was on display at the trade fair and then went to Nolte Auto-Krane in Hanover. Exactly 20 years later, the same customer received the successor LG 1800-1.0 with the same license plate. The driver has the same surname as back then: Rainer Schlesner is the son of the former driver Detlef.

Over the course of two decades, the LG 1750 has become a legend in the crane market. As the new 800-tonner clearly exceeds its performance, the new LG 1800-1.0 has been given the slogan "The legend grows". The new crane also features state-of-the-art crane technology such as V-Frame¬Æ, VarioTray, ZF Traxon Torque transmission with ECOdrive and WindSpeed Load Charts.LG, 800 tons, lattice boom crane, wind turbine, wind power, lattice boom, Nolte, LG 1800-1.0, wind farm, repowering, V-Frame, VarioTray, The legend grows, Windspeed load Charts.

‚ÄãThe Sarilar Group has taken delivery of a new Liebherr LR 1700-1.0 crawler crane. During its first job at the wind farm near Isparta, the crane with the 126 meter long boom was able to prove its performance. Sarilar opted for the LR 1700-1.0 because the crane can be used to assemble all wind turbines in Turkey. The use of boom sections in different crawler cranes is also a crucial element. This means that equipment components from the LR 1600 can be used on the LR 1700-1.0 W.
